config.question: Sir Edmund Andros was overthrown as governor of the Dominion of New England after __________.

answer_3.response: When news of the Glorious Revolution reached Boston, the Bay colonists overthrew the hated Andros regime. The New England version of the Glorious Revolution (April 18, 1689) was so popular that no one came to the governor’s defense. Andros was jailed without a shot having been fired.
